reviews.title: If it Had WiFi it Would be Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed here in 2 rooms for 2 nights after a 2 week ski trip in france and enjoyed the hotel. It is very well positioned with a metro stop adjacent to the hotel which we were given free tickets to by the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and we definitely would stay there again should we pass through.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Beautiful hotel, small, comfortable, with classic décor, and well placed in the beautiful city of Lausanne, the French R
reviews.text: The staff is friendly.
This hotel is in a quiet residential area, right next to the metro station and can be reached directly by metro in the direction of Ouchy from the train station.
reviews.title: Conveniently located and functional

reviews.text: Rooms are small but beautifully appointed, comfortable, clean and well-maintained. Our rooms have a small but lovely balcony.

reviews.text: Just by the side of the subway ("Délices station), this is a great hotel in Lausanne. The room isn't big, but it's confortable, quiet and beautiful.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: They don't have free wi-fi, but you can use internet for 30min if you ask them. As soon as you arrive, they'll give you a card to use all the transport in town.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: Simple and nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Good with some bad

reviews.text: I would surelly come back to this hotel
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: This is a lovely boutique hotel a ten minute walk from the boardwalk of Lake Lausanne. At half the cost or less than the lakeside hotels, it's worth it to be just a tiny bit off the beaten path. The hotel feels fancy though it isn't priced that way. The rooms are small but beautifully appointed. The staff is eager to please and thoroughly knowledgeable about the area. The hotel door is a hundred feet from the Metro, which takes you up and down the backbone of the city for free. The management was very kind and didn't charge me for a day when I mis-booked, which I appreciated no end. I was a bit hesitant to book because of the mixed reviews, but found nothing lacking in our stay. . .except the bed. Hard as a rock. If you like a hard bed you're in luck. If you need a softer one, probably best to ask them what they can do for you in advance.
reviews.title: Stop the vacuum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located right next to the metro (literally steps away), which was great. You do not even hear the metro go by, so noise was not an issue. The hotel is mid-way between the waterfront and downtown, making it a nice middle ground. It is also about a 10 min walk from the main train station (or alternatively, two metro stops away).
reviews.title: Great location, not so friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice and clean. Bathroom was too. Room was small, but that is to be expected in Europe, of course.
reviews.title: Yes, another with mixed thoughts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found that service varied according to who was working at the front desk, with only one out of the three people we dealt with being friendly. We found that friendly customer service is rare in Switzerland, with Lucerne being an exception. Overall, it lived up to the stereotype of being an absolutely beautiful country with slightly cold and unwelcoming people. Our experience with Lausanne and the Nash Carlton hotel was consistent with this view.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for Hotels would base this one on a 3/4Star Boutique type property. Agree, my husband and I are of the baby boomer age group travelling through Europe from Australia for 6 weeks and yes have 1 piece of medium heavy luggage each! Most unusual no bell hop and having to lug this up approx 10 steps.
reviews.title: Good if you get a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then to be met by the most unpolite receptionist(pregnant lady) I have ever come across! Ok we only speak English and yes we arrived approx 9.30am and yes new there was a possibility our room wouldn't be ready!!!!! But this person didn't even want to look at my paperwork with name booking etc and flatly said we were too early and that we would need to come back.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location love it
